column5: Doing the Pine Falls International (oct 6-7) for the first time never fished it before got a map and that's it, will prefish for a couple of days but a little help would be great.

danny do a search of pinefalls (also search it with a space pine falls) you will find alot of reading from past years manitoba .... a 100,000 lakes how many walleyes ???? i will never have enough time....

Look to find the channel edge in the bay. We usually try to go off of Robinson's Rock.(Big rock pile sticking out of water about 2 miles into the bay) Just go to the rock pile and go east. You will be in 10-12 feet of water, depending on water level. About 500 yards out, you will see it dropping off on your depth finder to 22 feet. Sit on the edge and anchor up and jig. Keep moving on the edges until you find the fish. If that is slow, put some plugs on and troll the flats of the bay.
